definition[0]: to be more concerned with making money from something than about its quality – used to show disapproval
explanation[0]: Commercialize is usually passive in this meaning
definition[1]: to sell something completely new to the public for the first time
example[1]: Some space launches will be commercialized to help pay for more space research.
definition[2]: to make something available to buyers for the first time
example[2]: He doesn’t see any rush to commercialize the Sunpower technology for household use.
definition[3]: to use something in a way that makes as much money as possible, without considering its quality
example[3]: the growing tendency to commercialize museums
